newsitem.title: POLAND: FIVE MORE STOCKS START LIVE WARSAW TRADE SEPT 16.
newsitem.headline: FIVE MORE STOCKS START LIVE WARSAW TRADE SEPT 16.

text.p: The Warsaw Stock Exchange will add five more stocks to its continuous stock trading system from September 16, bringing the total to 10, the bourse's deputy president said.
"The bourse's board decided to introduce on September 16 the following issues to continuous trade: Bank Slaski, Stalexport , Budimex , Universal and BRE ," Piotr Szeliga told a news briefing.
Szeliga said the bourse picked main-market issues which were among the highest in market capitalisation and turnover.
Since mid-July the bourse has traded continuously in BIG, BPH , Debica , Elektrim and Rolimpex.
Szeliga confirmed earlier bourse plans to have all 20 stocks in the exchange's blue-chip WIG 20 index quoted live by the end of this year.

He said that by the end of the year the bourse also wanted to enable investors to sell and buy same shares during the one daily session, which now is impossible because of rigid settlement procedures.
